FacilityName: U.S. Energy Partners, LLC DBA White Energy

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
US Energy Partners, LLC
Russell, Kansas

Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policies:

US Energy Partners, LLC has a commitment to worker and public safety.  This commitment is demonstrated in the resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel as well as considering safety in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of the facility.

US Energy Partners, LLC 's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.  However, if a release does occur, plant personnel will respond to contain the release as necessary.

Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:

US Energy Partners, LLC ethanol plant is located in the City of Russell, Russell County, Kansas.

The facility operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week for the purpose of manufacturing fuel grade ethanol from corn.  The regulated substance under the RMP program is Denaturant (also known as natural gasoline which is a flammable mixture).  US Energy Partners, LLC has determined that the radius of impact from a worst-case release of denaturant would be about 0.4 miles; due to the amount of denaturant stored on-site.

Off-site Consequence Analysis Results:

The worst-case scenario at the facility is based on the release of denaturant stored in a 39,000 gallon above ground storage tank followed by ignitition of the resulting vapor cloud.  The worst-case scenario is based on the release of a full tank (39,000 gallons).  The worst-case vapor cloud explosion generates a 1 psig over-pressure endpoint approximately 0.4 miles from the center of the plant.  Major commercial/industrial receptors are located within this distance.

The alternative scenario at the facility is based on release of denaturant from a tanker truck (10,000 gallons) followed by ignition of the resulting vapor cloud.  The alternative vapor cloud explosion generates a 1 psig over-pressure endpoint approximat

ely 0.2 miles from the center of the plant.  Major commercial/industrial receptors are located within this distance. 

Although US Energy Partners, LLC has numerous controls in place to prevent such a release and to manage potential consequences, no credit for administrative controls or passive mitigation measures were taken into account in evaluating these scenarios.

The facility qualifies as a Program 3 due to the close proximity of public receptors, and therefore, Program Safety Management has been completed for this facility.

Five Year Accident History:

There has never been an onsite or offsite release of denaturant at the US Energy Partners, LLC facility.

Emergency Response Program Information:

US Energy Partners, LLC ethanol plant has several safety programs in place at the facility that incorporate emergency response, including a Health and Safety Plan.  An SPCC plan has been developed and implemented in accordance with applicable regulatory standards.

The facility also conducts employee training as part of facility activities.  US Energy Partners, LLC 's corporate policy places the utmost importance on worker, public, and environmental safety - which is reflected in facility plans and training activities.  US Energy Partners, LLC recently became the first ethanol plant in the U.S. to become part of OSHA's Safety and Health Achievement Recognition Program (SHARPS).
